{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3468663,"name":"Albert M Wright","username":"AlbertEinstein","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/f04885/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-04T17:00:51.323Z","cooked":"

In the WPIlib docs, under the Introduction Step 3 subsection programming your Radio, it is recommended that two VH-109 Radios be used. Programming your Radio — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation (link attached), What would the actual difference be between running one vs two, and is it worth setting up a second radio on the robot?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-01-04T17:00:51.323Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":22,"reads":101,"readers_count":100,"score":135.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":478309,"topic_slug":"optimal-radio-setup","display_username":"Albert M Wright","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/zero-to-robot/step-3/radio-programming.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Programming your Radio — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":15}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53903,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/optimal-radio-setup/478309/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3468667,"name":"Alex","username":"legoguy1000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/legoguy1000/{size}/256261_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-04T17:03:31.708Z","cooked":"

The docs are referencing using 2 radios in a Access Point and Bridge mode like the field, not 2 on the robot. Doing this allows u to use the 6GHZ spectrum, otherwise if u run AP mode on the robot only, u have to run 2.4GHz

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-01-04T17:04:06.701Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":97,"readers_count":96,"score":19.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":478309,"topic_slug":"optimal-radio-setup","display_username":"Alex","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28614,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor & Alumnus"},"post_url":"/t/optimal-radio-setup/478309/2","custom_user_title":"Mentor & Alumnus","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3468668,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-04T17:04:13.802Z","cooked":"

The new radios running in 6 GHz while on battery cannot be an access point. This means that if you want the 6 GHz connection, a 2nd radio is required as an access point at your DS, which the robot would connect to.

AlbertEinstein:

What would the actual difference be between running one vs two, and is it worth setting up a second radio on the robot?

Did you have questions about the advantages/disadvantages listed on that page?
